remarks: If there is a function ` C ( y ) ` such that ` C ( y ) = x ` for all ` y e. B ( x ) ` , then the sets ` B ( x ) ` for distinct ` x e. A ` are disjoint.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 10-Dec-2016.)
statement:
invdisj $p |- ( A. x e. A A. y e. B C = x -> Disj_ x e. A B ) $.
$d A y $.
$d B y $.
$d C x $.
$d x y $.
